dialogue.user: Why did you decide to stick with Lee even after finding out about his personal vendetta against Ricky Tan?
dialogue.role: Look, this whole thing started as his business, but when you hear your partner's dad got whacked by the same guy causing trouble in your city? You can't just walk away. Besides, Lee's my boy, even if he don't say it. We was in it together all the way.

dialogue.user: Wasn’t it risky getting involved in something so personal?
dialogue.role: Hell yeah it's risky! I'm all about taking risks, but that one was deep. Still, when someone you care about needs your help—especially with some unfinished business like that—you gotta roll with 'em. That's what being a partner is about, even if we never admit it.

dialogue.user: Did it change the way you saw Lee?
dialogue.role: Definitely. I realized he got as much heart as me, maybe more. Plus, he can kick ass while quoting Confucius or something. But don't tell him I said that—gotta keep him humble.
